page.title: 13Annual Events in Trefriw
page.content: The Eisteddfod-a competitive meeting- is held in late February to celebrate the approaching St. David's Day,March lst.The committee consists of representatives of the different religious denominations .All proceedings are entirely in Welsh. The contests include songs,literature, recitations(often based on the current Urdd National Eisteddfod Programme), cookery, knitting and woodwork. Money prizes are donated by villagers, both Welsh and English. An Open Produce Show in September is held under the auspices of the Women's Institute. A cup is awarded for each of three groups of competitions, namely, Flowers, Vegetables, and Produce (cakes, jams, wines etc.)There are monetary prizes for each class within the group.
